meanings.definition: The act of making something old or obsolete.
meanings.sent1: Her antiquation of the technology rendered it useless.
meanings.sent2: The antiquation of the software led to the need for an upgrade.
meanings.sent3: The antiquation of his favorite toy made him nostalgic for simpler times.
meanings.sent4: The rapid antiquation of trends in fashion industry keeps designers on their toes.
meanings.sent5: The antiquation of the traditional methods paved the way for innovation.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming ancient or outdated.
meanings.sent1: The antiquation of the building was evident from its crumbling facade.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the antiquation of the language led to its revival as a historical dialect.
meanings.sent3: The antiquation of his jokes made them unintentionally funny.
meanings.sent4: The antiquation of his beliefs left him feeling adrift in a changing world.
meanings.sent5: The antiquation of the manuscript gave historians valuable insights into the past.
